title: Linux chgrp Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the chgrp command in Linux, learn how to change the group ownership of files and directories, and discover practical examples to enhance your user and permission management skills.

meta.title: Linux chgrp Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the chgrp command in Linux, learn how to change the group ownership of files and directories, and discover practical examples to enhance your user and permission management skills.
meta.keywords: Linux, chgrp, group ownership, file management, user permissions, command line, system administration

verify.name: Verify the group ownership of the file.txt file
verify.hint: The group ownership of the file.txt file should be changed to the admin group.

steps.title: Change the Group Ownership of a File

verify.name: Verify the group ownership of the myfile.txt file
verify.hint: The group ownership of the myfile.txt file should be changed to the admin group.

steps.title: Change the Group Ownership of Multiple Files

verify.name: Verify the group ownership of the files
verify.hint: The group ownership of both file1.txt and file2.txt should be changed to the admin group.
